thread.title: Paddle boarder swept 6km out to sea, found
thread.title_full: Paddle boarder swept 6km out to sea, found

title: Paddle boarder swept 6km out to sea, found
text:
Japanese paddler boarder survived 16 hours in the sea, off the coast of Bulli AMY HARRIS, The Sunday Telegraph January 14, 2017 3:51pm 
A JAPANESE tourist who was washed out to sea on a paddle board has managed to survive an entire night before being rescued completely unscathed. 
The unnamed man, 37, was swept six kilometres off the coast of Bulli on Thursday afternoon with only a large board to keep him afloat for the following 16 hours. 
Crew members from a 300-metre long container ship the MSC Damla later spotted the man seated upright and floating on the board on Friday morning and plucked him from the water. media_camera The man was swept six kilometres off the coast of Bulli before he was spotted by a crew members on a container ship. Picture: MSC Dalma media_camera He was given a change of clothes and drink. Picture: MSC Dalma 
Remarkably the man was in good spirits and was later released from Wollongong Hospital following a fluid check. 
“He was only admitted for a very short time which would give you an idea of the seriousness, or lack of seriousness, of his condition,” said a spokeswoman from Wollongong Hospital. 
“He was very quietly spoken and was basically quite keen to leave as soon as he could.” 
It’s understood the relatively warm overnight temperature of 21 degrees played a large factor in the man’s ability to remain healthy and alert.
